ygData.subject: Re: Re: Lots o Wizard groups
ygData.msgSnippet: I think the key to pulling in that particular situation is to just pull and sort out one individual mob and clear them all out rather than to try to just pull
ygData.messageBody:
I think the key to pulling in that particular situation is to just pull and
sort out one individual mob and clear them all out rather than to try to
just pull that knight out by himself. I have however pulled the King in
runneye from his elite guards before.

Kizmet Bayashi
E-Marr
Da`Kor
----- Original Message -----
From: Lombard.Mikhael <Mikhael_Lombard@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 12, 1999 9:25 AM
Subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] Re: Lots o Wizard groups


> From: "Lombard.Mikhael" <Mikhael_Lombard@...>
>
> I will say this, it is almost impossible for a monk to pull the knight out
> of the knight room from Runnyeye...tried many times.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tim Perkins [mailto:tperkins@...]
> Sent: Friday, October 08, 1999 8:19 AM
> To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Re: Lots o Wizard groups
>
>
> From: "Tim Perkins" <tperkins@...>
>
> Ever wonder why parties always want a monk to pull? Because the Monk IS
the
> best puler in the game Bar none. When was the last time a ranger was asked
> to pull the ghoul lord or froglock king room? Maybe when a monk wasnt
> available. Noone can split up groups of multiple mobs like a monk. Sure a
> ranger can track in a large zone but a Monk can pull outdoors also. when a
> Ranger can pull in all environments just as well as a monk then you will
> have a valid argument.
>
> Kizmet Bayashi
> 40th level monk
> Da`Kor
> E-Marr
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Sean O'Brien <sobrien@...>
> To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
> Sent: Thursday, October 07, 1999 11:36 PM
> Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Re: Lots o Wizard groups
>
>
> > From: "Sean O'Brien" <sobrien@...>
> >

> > > 1. Monk (best puller in the game bar none)
